data.title: About Us – Cloud Services – Nordcloud
data.meta_description: Nordcloud is a European cloud leader featured in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant. Learn how we help with Microsoft Azure, AWS and Google Cloud.
data.text:
One of our original founders, Pyry Lehdonvirta, becomes a published author with HTML5 as an Application, a go-to resource for application designers and developers – cementing our position as a pioneer in emerging technologies.

Nordcloud expands into its second country: Sweden.

We seize a leadership position in the cloud application design and development space by creating a living style guide, a predecessor of modern design systems.

Nordcloud secures €1 million funding from Finnvera, the Finnish public financing company, to help drive expansion. We open new offices in Norway and Germany.

As one of the world’s first AWS Lambda partners, we start delivering web-based applications based on cloud-native, serverless architectures.

Microsoft names us Partner of the Year.

The Financial Times names us as one of the 1,000 fastest-growing companies in Europe as part of its FT1000 ranking.

We open an office in Austria, giving us a presence in 10 countries.

We officially launch Nordcloud Klarity, our cloud management and FinOps SaaS product. We originally developed it for our own managed services team, but based on popular demand, made it generally available for people looking to get more automation, visibility and cost control with their clouds.

Microsoft names us Azure Infra Modernisation Partner of the Year.

AWS names us AWS Migration Partner of the Year.

Nordcloud achieves VMware Master Services Competency in VMware Cloud on AWS, making us one of the rare partners to have such high credentials across both VMware and AWS.

Nordcloud achieves a Google Cloud specialisation in infrastructure services.

Gartner recognises Nordcloud as a Visionary in its Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services.

Nordcloud becomes a signatory of Microsoft’s Partner Pledge, which is a commitment to helping people use technology in the right way and for the greater good.

Nordcloud is recognised as a Great Place to Work in Austria, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Netherlands, Poland and the UK.
